item.title: 壳牌认为亚洲新兴市场将在全球不断增长的液化天然气供应中占据更多份额
item.description: 壳牌预计，澳大利亚供应的液化天然气（LNG）将有助于满足南亚和东南亚新兴市场的需求，这些市场将在本世纪末吸收全球供应量的部分增长。【原文：Shell expects its Australian supplies of liquefied natural gas (LNG) to help meet demand from emerging markets in south and southeast Asia, which are tipped to absorb some of the pick up in global supplies towards the end of this decade.】

item.title: 百健公司将收购人类免疫学生物科学公司，交易金额高达 18 亿美元
item.description: 百健公司（Biogen）周三表示，已同意以 11.5 亿美元的预付款和高达 6.5 亿美元的潜在里程碑付款收购私人控股的人类免疫生物科学公司（Human Immunology Biosciences）。【原文：Biogen said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy privately held Human Immunology Biosciences for $1.15 billion in upfront and up to $650 million in potential milestone payments.】

item.title: 非价格零售商 TJX 因需求强劲、成本降低而上调年度利润预期
item.description: TJX Cos 周三上调了年度利润预期，第一季度销售额超出预期，主要得益于成本下降和需求强劲。【原文：TJX Cos raised its annual profit forecast and beat first-quarter sales estimates on Wednesday, helped by easing costs and robust demand.】

item.title: 中国多个城市降低首付和房贷利率，刺激房地产需求
item.description: 据中国国家媒体报道，中国多个城市降低了首付和按揭贷款利率，以响应最近一波刺激房地产需求的措施。【原文：Several cities across China have lowered down payment and mortgage loan interest rates, in response to the latest wave of stimulus measures to boost lackluster property demand, state media reported.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会官员认为到 2030 年私人芯片投资将达到 1000 亿美元
item.description: 欧盟委员会一位官员周三表示，《欧洲芯片法案》有望在2030年前帮助欧洲半导体产业吸引价值超过1000亿欧元（1084.1亿美元）的私人投资。【原文：The European Chips Act is on track to help attract more than 100 billion euros ($108.41 billion) worth of private investment to the European semiconductor industry by 2030, a European Commission official said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 模拟器件公司预测季度收入高于预期
item.description: 模拟器件公司（Analog Devices）周三预测，第三季度收入将高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于汽车和工业芯片需求在长期低迷后出现增长。【原文：Analog Devices forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, helped by a rise in demand for its automotive and industrial chips after a prolonged slump.】

item.title: 标准普尔称，尽管汽车供应减少，但美国人的平均汽车保有年限仍达到创纪录的 12.6 年
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，美国车主对汽车的持有时间正在延长，即使 COVID 大流行造成的重大供应中断情况有所缓解，经销商的供应量也在增加。【原文：Automobile owners in the United States are holding on to their vehicles longer, according to a new study, even as major supply disruptions caused by the COVID pandemic ease and availability at dealerships rise.】

item.title: 阿根廷铁路建设者在米莱公司削减开支的阴影下备受煎熬
item.description: 阿根廷工人巴勃罗-巴斯克斯（Pablo Vazquez）在布宜诺斯艾利斯郊区拉普拉塔附近为一条火车线路铺设轨道，一天的工作刚刚结束，工头就把十几名工友叫到一起，告诉他们一个坏消息。工人们都被解雇了。【原文：Argentine laborer Pablo Vazquez was finishing a day's shift laying track for a train line near La Plata on the outskirts of Buenos Aires when the foremen called a dozen members of the team together to share bad news. The workers were all being let go.】

item.title: 美国消费者监督机构将对 "先买后付 "公司实施信用卡规则
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护局（U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）周三表示，该局将对 "先买后付"（BNPL）贷款机构适用一些信用卡消费者保护规则，以加强对这一快速增长行业的监管。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will apply some credit card consumer protection rules to buy now, pay later (BNPL) lenders, the agency said on Wednesday, in a bid to impose more oversight on the fast-growing sector.】

item.title: 巴西法院裁定巴西国家石油公司在 1.93 亿美元税案中败诉
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）周二晚些时候表示，巴西高等法院驳回了该公司对征收约 9.87 亿雷亚尔（约合 1.9268 亿美元）税款的上诉。【原文：Brazil's Superior Court of Justice has denied state-run oil company Petrobras an appeal against the collection of some 987 million reais ($192.68 million) in taxes, the company said late on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特木运营商 PDD Holdings 第一季度收入超出预期
item.description: 点点客控股公司（PDD Holdings）周三公布的第一季度营收超出预期，主要得益于其国际购物网站Temu的强劲应用，以及中国国内折扣电子商务平台拼多多吸引了更多注重价格的顾客。【原文：PDD Holdings beat first-quarter revenue estimates on Wednesday, powered by strong adoption of its international shopping site, Temu, and as Chinese domestic discount e-commerce platform Pinduoduo attracted more price-conscious customers.】

item.title: 欧洲股市将陷入停滞，2025 年才会回升--路透调查
item.description: 欧洲股市的破纪录上涨使其在 2024 年下半年更容易受到回调的影响，尽管该地区经济的复苏和降息周期的开始被认为会在 2025 年将其推回到新的高峰。【原文：A record-breaking run in European shares has made them more vulnerable to possible pull-backs in the latter part of 2024, although the region's recovering economy and the start of a rate-cut cycle is seen pushing them back to new peaks in 2025.】

item.title: 目标公司业绩疲软，可自由支配支出持续承压
item.description: 塔吉特周三预计，本季度可比销售额和利润将大幅低于华尔街预期，此前疲软的自由支配支出削弱了其第一季度业绩，塔吉特表示继续预计消费者将持谨慎态度。【原文：Target on Wednesday forecast current-quarter comparable sales and profit largely below Wall Street expectations after weak discretionary spending dented its first-quarter results, and said it continues to expect the consumer to be cautious.】

item.title: 峰会东道主韩国表示全球必须在人工智能技术方面开展合作
item.description: 韩国科学和信息技术部长周三表示，在韩国主办的关于快速发展的人工智能技术的全球峰会结束之际，全世界必须合作以确保人工智能的成功发展。【原文：South Korea's science and information technology minister said on Wednesday the world must cooperate to ensure the successful development of AI, as a global summit on the rapidly evolving technology hosted by his country wrapped up.】

item.title: 新兴市场信用评级终于重回正轨
item.description: 从巴西、尼日利亚和土耳其到埃及和赞比亚等一些风险最高的新兴市场，越来越多的证据表明，长达十年之久的主权信用评级恶化终于开始逆转。【原文：From Brazil, Nigeria and Turkey to even some of the riskiest emerging markets such as Egypt and Zambia, evidence is growing that a decade-long deterioration in sovereign credit ratings has finally started to reverse.】

item.title: 英伟达业绩和美联储会议纪要将考验华尔街的创纪录表现，期指走势低迷
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货走势低迷，投资者关注本周最大的事件--人工智能芯片领军企业英伟达（Nvidia）的季度财报和美联储将在当天晚些时候公布的政策会议纪要。【原文：U.S. index futures were subdued on Wednesday as investors zeroed in on the week's biggest events, AI chip leader Nvidia's quarterly results and the Federal Reserve's policy meeting minutes due later in the day.】

item.title: 财富代数加洛韦教授的财政公式
item.description: 翻开大多数个人理财书籍，你会发现一些常见的小窍门，比如如何最大限度地利用信用卡奖励或免收银行手续费。【原文：Open most personal finance books, and you will find the usual tips like how to maximize credit card rewards or get a bank fee waived.】

item.title: 早间竞价：英伟达（Nvidia）逼近目标，英国 CPI 大涨未达目标
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美联储将话题转向 "情景"，政策变得越来越不确定
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在5月1日的新闻发布会上说，他不想谈论经济 "假设"，但这正是他和其他美国央行官员在讨论货币政策时所转向的话题，因为在努力抑制通胀的过程中，货币政策已经到了一个不确定的关头。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said in a May 1 press conference he didn't want to talk about economic "hypotheticals," but that's what he and other U.S. central bank officials have shifted towards in discussing monetary policy that has hit an uncertain juncture in the effort to tame inflation.】

item.title: 流亡中国商人郭文贵因涉嫌欺诈受审
item.description: 美国检方指控流亡海外的中国商人郭文贵诈骗了数千名投资者和支持者超过 10 亿美元，本周三，郭文贵的刑事审判将开始挑选陪审团。【原文：Jury selection begins on Wednesday in the criminal trial of exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui, who U.S. prosecutors have accused of defrauding thousands of investors and supporters out of more than $1 billion.】

item.title: 中国对 12 家与美国军方有关联的公司采取措施
item.description: 中国周三表示，作为对美国武装台湾和制裁中国公司的回应，中国已对参与美国军工综合体的12家公司及其高级管理人员采取措施。【原文：China said on Wednesday it had taken measures against 12 companies involved in the U.S. military-industrial complex and their senior executives, in response to the U.S. arming of Taiwan and sanctions on Chinese companies.】

item.title: 亚马逊网络服务公司将投资 170.2 亿美元在西班牙建设数据中心
item.description: 科技巨头亚马逊的云计算部门亚马逊网络服务公司（AWS）周三表示，将在西班牙阿拉贡地区投资 157 亿欧元（170.2 亿美元）建设数据中心，以升级其在西班牙的发展计划。【原文：Tech giant Amazon's cloud computing unit Amazon Web Services (AWS) said on Wednesday it will invest 15.7 billion euros ($17.02 billion) in data centres in Spain's Aragon region as it upgraded its growth plan in the country.】

item.title: 日本岸田公开推动资本市场改革
item.description: 日本首相岸田文雄周三在东京向数百名全球投资者发表演讲，承诺进一步改革资本市场并促进资产管理，公开向外国投资示好。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida made a public push to woo foreign investment on Wednesday, pledging further capital markets reform and promoting asset management in a speech to hundreds of global investors in Tokyo.】

item.title: 美国公布对华加征关税细节，部分关税将于8月1日开始征收
item.description: 美国贸易代表办公室周三表示，对包括电动汽车电池、计算机芯片和医疗产品在内的一系列中国进口产品大幅提高关税的部分措施将在30天的征求意见期结束后于8月1日生效。【原文：The U.S. Trade Representative's office on Wednesday said some of the steep tariff increases on an array of Chinese imports including electric vehicle batteries, computer chips and medical products will take effect on August 1 after a 30-day comment period ends.】

item.title: 研究机构称中国应将大型汽车关税提高至 25
item.description: 一位隶属于政府的汽车研究机构专家告诉中国《环球时报》，中国应将大型汽油动力汽车的进口关税提高到 25%，因为中国面临着美国大幅提高的汽车进口关税，而且进入欧盟也可能需要缴纳额外的关税。【原文：China should raise its import tariffs on large gasoline-powered cars to 25%, a government-affiliated auto research body expert told China's Global Times newspaper as the country faces sharply higher U.S. auto import duties and possibly additional duties to enter the European Union】

item.title: 瑞银调查显示：全球家族办公室最关注地缘政治风险
item.description: 瑞银最近的一项调查显示，重大地缘政治冲突是全球家族办公室近期和中期的首要风险，而北美和亚太地区将成为新资产配置的首选目的地。【原文：A major geopolitical conflict is the top risk for global family offices in both the near- and medium-term, while North America and Asia Pacific are set to become the top destinations for fresh asset allocations, a recent UBS survey found.】

item.title: Stellantis 首席执行官：电动汽车关税是个陷阱
item.description: Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）周三表示，Stellantis 预计将在欧洲电动汽车市场与中国竞争对手展开一场大战，并预计会因此产生重大社会影响。【原文：Stellantis expects a major battle with Chinese rivals in the European market for electric vehicles and expects significant social consequences as a result, the group's Chief Executive Carlos Tavares said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 乐天与 eBay 合作测试美国二手日本时尚商品市场
item.description: 日本乐天集团（Rakuten Group）正在与 eBay 合作，测试美国对日本二手时尚商品的需求。【原文：Japan's Rakuten Group is partnering with eBay to test U.S. demand for used Japanese fashion goods, made all the cheaper with the yen trading near a 34-year low.】

item.title: 必和必拓与安格洛的前景预示着矿商未来将有更多并购活动
item.description: 投资者和矿业首席执行官周三表示，必和必拓对英美资源集团的竞购凸显了矿商对铜等能源转型金属日益增长的需求，他们必须更加积极地争取新项目，否则就有可能错失良机。【原文：BHP's bid for Anglo American underlines the growing appetite for energy transition metals like copper from miners who must become more aggressive to secure new projects or risk missing out, investors and mining CEOs said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 马克龙敦促道达尔能源在美国上市后留在法国
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）在周三发表的一篇访谈中，在回答有关石油巨头道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）可能寻求在美国上市的问题时表示，法国支持那些对国家有信心的公司。【原文：France supports companies that believe in the country, its President Emmanuel Macron said in an interview published on Wednesday, in response to a question on oil major TotalEnergies' potential pursuit of a U.S. listing.】
